page.title: 01Callington's Catchment Area
page.content: Our D- Block is situated in south- east Cornwall in the district administered by{Caradon Council. It is a{rural}area,characterised by small farms, hamlets and villages like Kelly Bray, Golberdon and Maders. { Callington}a small town of 3.5 thousand inhabitants. is the local commercial and residential centre serving Plymouth as a dormitory town. The town has a {Parish Council},two of whom sit on the District Council. The parish leader is called the {Portreeve}the equivalent of mayor. Recently, an attempt has been made to revive the once thriving{mineral {mining industry}in the locality. Though off the tourist beat, the area enjoys some visitors,who come for{peace and spectacular views.
